structure.unit: ADMINISTRATION OF TRUSTS -- LEGAL INVESTMENTS -- UNIFORM PRINCIPAL AND INCOME ACT

text.section: In exercising the power to adjust under KRS 386.454(1) or (2) or a discretionary power of administration regarding a matter within the scope of KRS 386.450 to 386.504, whether granted by the terms of a trust, a will, or KRS 386.450 to 386.504, a fiduciary shall administer a trust or estate impartially, based on what is fair and reasonable to all of the beneficiaries, except to the extent that the terms of the trust or the will clearly manifest a contrary intention. Except as provided in this subsection, determination in accordance with KRS 386.450 to 386.504 shall be presumed to be fair and reasonable to all of the beneficiaries.

law.history: Amended 2014 Ky. Acts ch. 25, sec. 105, effective July 15, 2014. -- Created 2004 Ky. Acts ch. 158, sec. 2, effective January 1, 2005.
